### CAGR

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| results: asis
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

set.seed(123456)

Tyears <- sample(3:8, 1)                 # number of years
initial <- round(runif(1, 80, 150), 0)   # initial value
target_cagr <- runif(1, 0.04, 0.14)      # target CAGR between 4% and 14%
final <- initial * (1 + target_cagr)^Tyears

CAGR <- (final / initial)^(1 / Tyears) - 1
```

An investment grew from **`r round(initial, 2)`** to **`r round(final, 2)`** over **`r Tyears`** years.


::: {.question-block}

What is the CAGR (in %)?</strong>&nbsp;</label> <input type="number" id="module2_num_qCAGR_class" name="module2_num_qCAGR_class" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;" data-correct-answer=`r round(CAGR * 100, 2)` data-tolerance="0.10" /> </form> <div id="feedback-module2_num_qCAGR_class" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;"> ✅ <strong>Solution:</strong> CAGR = \(\big(\frac{\text{Final}}{\text{Initial}}\big)^{1/T} - 1\). Here, \(\big(\frac{`r round(final,2)`}{`r round(initial,2)`}\big)^{1/`r Tyears`} − 1 = <strong>`r round(CAGR*100, 2)`%</strong>. </div> 
                                                                                                                                                                  
:::
